p: In the metal guanidinium formates, C(NH 2) 3[ M II(HCO 2) 3] (henceforth MGF), the metal ions M are linked by formate ions into a network, with the guanidinium ions occupying the cubic interstices [ 26]. The guanidinium ions act as struts that support the framework through the snug hydrogen-bonded fit between guanidinium and formate ions ( figure 1 a). As a result of this strong interaction, the guanidinium ions are crystallographically ordered, in contrast with, for instance, the dimethylammonium metal formates [ 27] and the guanidinium metal cyanides [ 28], where the guestâ€“framework interaction is weaker and the guest ions are disordered at room temperature.
